brownshome.scriptwars.client

Class Network

  • java.lang.Object
    • brownshome.scriptwars.client.Network

  • public class Network
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class that clients can use to communicate with the server. This class has an internal data buffer of 1024 bytes. Attempts to write more data than that will lead to errors. Example Usage: 
     
 public static main(String[] args) { 
        Network.connect(ID, "13.55.154.170", 35565, "John Smith");
  
        while(Network.nextTick()) {
                //Read data using Network.getX();
  
                //Send data using Network.sendX();
        }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public static void connect(int ID,
                           java.lang.String ip,
                           int port,
                           java.lang.String name)
        Call this using the ID given to you by the website to connect
        Parameters:
        ID - The ID given to you by the website
        ip - The ip of the website
        port - The port the server uses, usually 35565
        name - The name of your bot

      • nextTick

        public static boolean nextTick()
        Waits until all the players have made their moves and sends the data and retrieved a new set of data from the server. This method returns false if the game is over or you have timed out.
        Returns:
        If the client was disconnected or timed out.

      • hasData

        public static boolean hasData()
        Checks if the next getX() will throw an exception. Note that even though this method returns false getBoolean() may not error if there are booleans left in the buffer.
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one byte left to be read

      • getInt

        public static int getInt()
        Gets a single integer from the data.
        Returns:
        An integer from the data

      • getByte

        public static int getByte()
        Gets a single byte from the data. This byte is returned as an integer in the range 0-255
        Returns:
        An integer containing the read byte.

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean()
        Gets a true or false value from the data.
        Returns:
        A boolean read from the data.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString()
        Gets a string from the data.
        Returns:
        The decoded String object

      • getData

        public static java.nio.ByteBuffer getData()
        Gets the raw packet data, Only use this if you know what you are doing. Note that any calls to getX() will update the position pointer in the buffer.
        Returns:
        The ByteBuffer containing the raw data sent by the server.

      • getFloat

        public static float getFloat()
        Gets a floating point number from the data
        Returns:
        The decoded floating point value

      • sendInt

        public static void sendInt(int i)
        Sends a single integer to the server.
        Parameters:
        i - The integer to send.

      • sendByte

        public static void sendByte(int i)
        Sends a single byte to the server. This byte is send as a value from 0-255. If the integer contains values larger that that the lowest 8 bits will be taken.
        Parameters:
        i - An integer containing a value from 0-255.

      • sendFloat

        public static void sendFloat(float f)

      • sendData

        public static void sendData(byte[] data)
        Sends raw data to the server. Only use this if you know what you are doing. Ensure that the limit and position are set properly.
        Parameters:
        data - A byte array holding the data to send.

      • sendString

        public static void sendString(java.lang.String s)
        Sends a String to the server.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to send to the server.
